p:
The results confirmed that Australia experienced decoupling between CO2 emissions and real income in 22 of 27 periods. Only in the periods 1990–1991, 1991–1992, 1994–1995, 2000–2001, and 2014–2015, did re-coupling of CO2 emissions and real income occur in the country. Australia’s real income increased annually, by an average of 3.1% between 1990 and 2017. In addition, the annual average increase in its emissions was calculated as 1.5% for the same period. Therefore, a relative decoupling was observed between the country’s CO2 and real income in the studied period. In the periods where re-coupling was experienced, the economic growth rate was smaller than that of emissions. The decoupling factor results between Australia’s CO2 emissions and real income are presented in Fig. 5.3Fig. 5
Decoupling factor results of Australia’s CO2 and real income over 1990–2017
